timeline.message: Added azure-sdk-bom and dependency json to run dependency checker

timeline.bodyText: Should this be 1.0.0 instead? I don't think we are releasing beta versions for BOM.

replies.bodyText: Just left as 1.0.0-beta.1 for now, will update when being released.

timeline.bodyText: Is this empty build section required?

replies.bodyText: Can remove for now, it will be populated once @JonathanGiles completes his updates to the dependency checker tool so it can be built in and fail build if there are version conflicts.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Should this file go under eng/pipelines/?
timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,43 @@
+# DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE
+# This file is generated automatically and any changes will be lost.

replies.bodyText: Nope, this is akin to the other ci.yml files that exist under all the module root directories.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Same here - should this be moved to eng/pipelines?
timeline.author: srnagar
srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,43 @@
+# DO NOT EDIT THIS FILE
+# This file is generated automatically and any changes will be lost.
+
+resources:
+  repositories:
+    - repository: azure-sdk-build-tools
+      type: git
+      name: internal/azure-sdk-build-tools
+    - repository: azure-sdk-tools
+      type: github
+      name: Azure/azure-sdk-tools
+      endpoint: azure
+
+trigger:
+  branches:
+    include:
+      - master
+      - hotfix/*
+      - release/*
+  paths:
+    include:
+      - sdk/bom/
+
+pr:
+  branches:
+    include:
+      - master
+      - feature/*
+      - hotfix/*
+      - release/*
+  paths:
+    include:
+      - sdk/bom/
+
+stages:
+  - template: ../../eng/pipelines/templates/stages/archetype-sdk-client.yml
+    parameters:
+      ServiceDirectory: keyvault

timeline.message: Added build plugin to run dependency checker

timeline.bodyText: This file is no longer necessary
timeline.author: JonathanGiles

timeline.bodyText: You might want to include a comment here about the purpose of this plugin, how to use it, and what the outcomes / reports will be.
timeline.author: JonathanGiles

@@ -0,0 +1,131 @@
+<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
+         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"

+  <packaging>pom</packaging>
+  <name>Azure Java SDK BOM (Bill of Materials)</name>
+  <description>Azure Java SDK BOM (Bill of Materials)</description>
+  <url>https://github.com/azure/azure-sdk-for-java</url>
+

+      </dependency>
+

+        <version>1.0.1</version>

+        <version>1.0.2</version>
+      </dependency>

+      </dependency>

+      <dependency>
+        <groupId>com.azure</groupId>
+        <artifactId>azure-storage-blob-batch</artifactId>
+        <version>12.2.0</version>

replies.bodyText: Can we please place this under: sdk/boms/azure-sdk-bom/pom.xml? I don't want to break the structure that has been established.
replies.author: mitchdenny

timeline.bodyText: Please do a little bit of research on the common naming patterns of these BOMs in other libraries - this was just the name I randomly selected when I mocked up this BOM.
timeline.author: JonathanGiles

replies.bodyText: Looking at a few other project there appears to be a similar naming pattern of <project reference>-bom, I'm going to leave the artifact name as azure-sdk-bom.
replies.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            To consume the BOM add it as an artifact in the dependency management section of your project's POM.
          
          
            
            To consume the BOM include it in the `dependencyManagement` section of your project's POM. Note that this **does not** result in all dependencies being included in your project.
timeline.author: JonathanGiles
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,48 @@
+# Azure BOM for client libraries
+The Azure BOM for client libraries provides a verified group of artifacts that are known to share a common dependency set. It provides a simple and elegant way to manage dependencies on multiple Azure client libraries.  
+
+## Table of contents
+- [Getting started](#getting-started)
+  - [Adding the BOM to your project](#adding-the-bom-to-your-project)
+  - [Adding libraries to your project](#adding-libraries-to-your-project)
+
+## Getting started
+
+### Adding the BOM to your project
+
+To consume the BOM add it as an artifact in the dependency management section of your project's POM.

timeline.message: Removed unnecessary files and moved into a more appropriate location

timeline.bodyText: You need to update this file with the new path
timeline.author: JonathanGiles

timeline.bodyText: Should this be boms or bom?
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: @mitchdenny asked for this to be placed under /boms. Mitch, does this align with directory changes to support Spring BOMs?
replies.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Well the parent POM restructuring change I have (when I eventually land it) will put parent poms in sdk/parents. So in sticking with pluralization sdk/boms :)
replies.author: mitchdenny
